title.value: An empirical study of testing machine learning in the wild
title.justification: The title effectively captures the essence of the paper, focusing on an empirical study of testing machine learning systems in real-world scenarios.
title.quote: An empirical study of testing machine learning in the wild

extractions.description: The paper performs a detailed empirical study on the testing strategies used in machine learning workflows in real-world settings. It examines the common testing strategies, properties tested, and types of tests used by analyzing test cases from 11 open-source ML/DL projects on GitHub.

type.justification: The study involves analyzing actual test cases and testing practices from real ML projects on GitHub, making it an empirical study that draws conclusions from observed data.
type.quote: We conduct the �rst �ne-grained empirical study on ML testing practices in the wild, aiming to identify the ML properties being tested, the testing strategies employed, and their implementation throughout the ML work�ow.

name.justification: The research focuses on testing practices and strategies for machine learning systems, a specific subfield within software engineering and quality assurance.
name.quote: This study sheds light on the current adoption of software testing techniques and highlights gaps and limitations in existing ML testing practices.

name.justification: The paper mentions specific testing practices and ML properties in CV systems, such as in autonomous systems.
name.quote: Bias and Fairness is more tested in Recommendation (6%) and CV (3.9%) systems.

name.justification: NLP systems are specifically addressed in terms of bias and fairness testing, among other properties.
name.quote: Bias and Fairness is more tested in Recommendation (6%) and CV (3.9%) systems, while Security & Privacy is tested in CV (2%), Application Platforms (0.9%), and NLP (0.5%).

name.justification: Testing practices specific to recommendation systems are discussed in terms of bias and fairness.
name.quote: Bias and Fairness is more tested in Recommendation (6%) and CV (3.9%) systems.
